section.title: Using The &name-icinga;stats Utility
section.para: A utility called &name-stats; is included in the &name-icinga; distribution. It is compiled and installed along with the main &name-icinga; daemon. The &name-stats; utility allows you to obtain various information about a running &name-icinga; process that can be very helpful in tuning performance. You can obtain information either in human-readable or performance data compatible format.
You can run the &name-stats; utility with the --help option to get usage information.

To obtain human-readable information on the performance of a running &name-icinga; process, run the &name-stats; utility with the -c command line argument to specify your main configuration file location like such:
section.screen:

section.para: As you can see, the utility displays a number of different metrics pertaining to the &name-icinga; process. Metrics which have multiple values are (unless otherwise specified) min, max and average values for that particular metric.

You can use the &name-stats; utility to display various &name-icinga; metrics using &name-pnp; (or other compatible programmes). To do so, run the &name-stats; utility using the --mrtg and --data arguments. The --data argument is used to specify what statistics should be graphed. Possible values for the --data argument can be found by running the &name-stats; utility with the --help option.

note.para: Information on using the &name-stats; utility to generate &name-pnp; graphs for &name-icinga; performance statistics can be found here.
